title: What Is the Shell?
content:
Definition

The shell is a program that reads commands you type and runs other programs. It is the command interpreter between you and the operating system.

Common shells include sh, bash, zsh, and fish. On many modern macOS systems the default is zsh; on many Linux systems it is bash (or another POSIX shell).

Terminal vs Shell

  • Terminal: the application window that displays text and sends your keystrokes.
  • Shell: the program running inside the terminal that interprets and executes commands.

How the shell runs a command

  1. Parse your input (split into command + arguments)
  2. Expand variables (e.g., $HOME) and globs (e.g., *.txt)
  3. Search for the executable in $PATH
  4. Start a process and connect input/output streams

First commands

pwd
ls
echo "Hello UNIX"
whoami
echo "$SHELL"

Key idea: composition

UNIX tools are designed to be combined. You will frequently chain tools together with pipes and redirection.
